title: Quick Bee AI Growth Engine — Full-Stack AI Agency Platform Dashboard

requirements.text: Apply a premium dark agency visual theme across the entire frontend: teal-green gradient (#00b4a6 to #00d4c8) blended with deep black (#0a0a0a) and white (#ffffff), glassmorphism card surfaces (backdrop-blur, semi-transparent borders), bold sans-serif typography (e.g. Inter/Space Grotesk), soft colored shadows, and high-contrast accent highlights. Enforce this theme consistently across all pages and components.

quotes: premium UI design theme using a teal green gradient blended with black and white, featuring smooth glassmorphism effects, bold typography, soft shadows, and high-quality 3D icons with depth, lighting, and realistic perspective for a clean, futuristic agency-style interface

acceptanceCriteria: All pages use dark background (#0a0a0a or similar deep black)
Cards have glassmorphism effect (backdrop-blur, translucent background, subtle border)
Teal-green gradient (#00b4a6–#00d4c8) used for primary CTAs, highlights, and headings
Bold typography is consistent across headings and body text
No login page — app routes directly to the dashboard on load

requirements.text: Bypass all authentication. The app must route users directly to the main dashboard on load without any login, registration, or Internet Identity prompt.

quotes: No login required — bypass authentication and route users directly to the dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to '/' renders the dashboard immediately
No login screen, auth guard, or identity prompt is shown
All routes are publicly accessible

requirements.text: Build a persistent sidebar navigation with links to all major sections: Dashboard (home), Lead Management, Services Catalog, Service Management, AI Smart Systems, Sales Configuration, Automation Dashboard, Automation Workflows, Analytics Engine, AI Content Creator, Webhook Logs, and Checkout. The sidebar must display the Quick Bee logo/brand name and collapse to icon-only on smaller screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar is visible on all pages
All 12 sections are reachable via sidebar links
Active route is visually highlighted
Sidebar collapses to icon-only on mobile/small viewports

requirements.text: Implement a Lead Management CRM backend in Motoko with stable storage for lead records. Each lead has fields: id (auto-generated), name, email, phone, serviceInterest, status (New / Contacted / Qualified / Proposal Sent / Closed Won / Closed Lost), and notes. Expose CRUD query/update functions: createLead, getLeads, updateLead, deleteLead.

quotes: Lead Management CRM — add/edit/delete leads with fields (name, email, phone, service interest, status, notes), CSV/PDF export, and lead status pipeline

acceptanceCriteria: createLead stores a new lead and returns its id
getLeads returns all leads as an array
updateLead updates any field of an existing lead by id
deleteLead removes a lead by id
Lead status is constrained to the 6 defined values

requirements.text: Build the Lead Management CRM frontend page. Display leads in a table and a Kanban-style pipeline view switchable by toggle. Support adding, editing (inline modal), and deleting leads. Include a CSV export button (downloads all leads as .csv) and a PDF export button (uses browser print or a PDF library to export the lead table). Each pipeline column corresponds to one of the 6 status values.

quotes: Lead Management CRM — add/edit/delete leads with fields (name, email, phone, service interest, status, notes), CSV/PDF export, and lead status pipeline

acceptanceCriteria: Table view shows all lead fields with edit/delete actions per row
Kanban view shows leads grouped by status in draggable columns
Add Lead modal collects all 6 fields and submits to backend
CSV export downloads a correctly formatted .csv file
PDF export triggers a print-ready view or downloads a PDF
Lead status changes update the backend via updateLead

requirements.text: Implement Agency Services data in the Motoko backend with stable storage. Store managed services with fields: id, name, category (one of: Web Dev, App Dev, AI Automation, Digital Marketing, Branding, SaaS, Business Setup), description, packages (array of: tier name, price in INR, features list), addons (array of: name, price), maintenancePlan (monthly price), isVisible (bool), sortOrder (int). Expose CRUD: createService, getServices, updateService, deleteService, reorderServices.

quotes: Agency Services Management — a full services catalog with 7 categories
30 individual packages
monthly maintenance plans
3 master agency plans (Spark/Surge/Titan)

acceptanceCriteria: createService persists a new service with all fields
getServices returns all services sorted by sortOrder
updateService modifies any field by id
deleteService removes a service by id
reorderServices accepts an ordered array of ids and updates sortOrder

requirements.text: Build the Agency Services Catalog frontend page. Display all 7 categories as filterable tabs. Show 30 pre-seeded service cards across categories with tiered pricing in INR (Student / Business / Premium / Enterprise). Each service card has: name, category badge, pricing tiers, a Buy Now button that adds to cart, and a Preview button that opens a modal showing full details (packages, add-ons, price calculator). Include a section for 3 Master Agency Plans: Spark, Surge, and Titan — displayed as premium plan cards with full feature lists and Buy Now CTAs. Show monthly maintenance plan pricing on relevant service cards.

quotes: a full services catalog with 7 categories
tiered pricing (Student/Business/Premium/Enterprise in INR)
30 individual packages
monthly maintenance plans
3 master agency plans (Spark/Surge/Titan)

acceptanceCriteria: 7 category filter tabs are displayed and functional
At least 30 service cards are pre-seeded across categories
Each card shows INR pricing for all 4 tiers
Preview modal shows packages, add-ons, and dynamic price calculator
3 Master Plan cards (Spark/Surge/Titan) are displayed prominently
Buy Now button on every card adds item to the cart
Maintenance plan pricing is shown on applicable cards

requirements.text: Build a Service Management admin page. Display all services in a sortable, drag-and-drop reorderable list. Each row/card supports: Edit (opens modal to update all fields), Duplicate (clones the service), Delete (with confirmation), and Visibility toggle (isVisible). The Edit modal supports configuring packages (Basic/Standard/Premium tiers with price and features), add-ons (name + price each), and maintenance plan pricing. Drag-and-drop reorder calls reorderServices on the backend to persist order. A Create New Service button opens a blank edit modal.

quotes: a separate Service Management page where users can create, edit, duplicate, delete, reorder via drag-and-drop, and toggle visibility of custom services. Each service supports packages (Basic/Standard/Premium), add-ons, quantity selector, dynamic price calculator, and a preview modal

acceptanceCriteria: Services list is drag-and-drop reorderable and order persists to backend
Edit modal has fields for all service attributes including packages, add-ons, and maintenance
Duplicate creates a copy of the service
Delete removes the service after confirmation
Visibility toggle updates isVisible on the backend
Preview modal shows how the service card will appear on the catalog
Dynamic price calculator in the preview responds to quantity and selected add-ons

requirements.text: Build the AI Smart Systems page with 6 AI-powered tool panels: Service Recommender, Proposal Generator, Pricing Strategy, Closing Scripts, Follow-Up Messages, and Lead Qualification. Each tool has a dedicated input form (e.g., lead details, service type, budget), a Generate button that POSTs to the configured OpenAI-compatible API endpoint (from Sales Configuration) with an appropriate prompt, displays the streamed/returned result in a formatted output box, and provides an Export button to download the result as a .txt or .pdf file. If API credentials are not configured, show a warning linking to the Sales Configuration page.

quotes: 6 AI-powered tools (Service Recommender, Proposal Generator, Pricing Strategy, Closing Scripts, Follow-Up Messages, Lead Qualification) that call an OpenAI-compatible API endpoint using saved credentials, display results, and export output

acceptanceCriteria: All 6 tool panels are rendered on the page
Each tool posts to the saved API endpoint with correct Authorization header
Generated output is displayed in a readable formatted box
Export button downloads the output as a text or PDF file
Warning message shown if API endpoint or key is not configured
Each API call is logged to the Webhook Logs store

requirements.text: Build the Sales System Configuration settings page. Display input fields and ON/OFF toggles for: API Endpoint, API Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID, Razorpay Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL, and Calendly URL. Each credential shows a connection status badge (Not Configured / Connected / Error). CRM Webhook URL and Automation Webhook URL each have a Test Connection button that fires a POST request and updates the badge based on response. All values are saved to and loaded from localStorage. A Save button persists all changes at once.

quotes: a settings page to save API Endpoint, API Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID/Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL, and Calendly URL — each with an ON/OFF toggle and connection status badge (Not Configured / Connected / Error). CRM and Automation Webhook URLs have Test Connection buttons

acceptanceCriteria: All 9 credential fields are present with input and toggle
Values persist to localStorage on Save
Page loads saved values from localStorage on mount
Each field shows correct status badge based on whether a value is saved
Test Connection on webhook URLs fires a POST and updates badge to Connected or Error
Toggling OFF disables the credential from being used in automations

requirements.text: Build the Automation Dashboard page with 5 automation toggles: WhatsApp Auto-Reply, Proposal Auto-Send, Lead Follow-Up Sequences, Payment Confirmation, and Project Onboarding. Toggles read from and write to a centralized localStorage config store key (e.g., 'quickbee_automation_config'). When a toggle is ON and its corresponding trigger fires, the system must POST to the configured Automation Webhook URL with a JSON payload describing the automation event and an Authorization header using the saved API Key. Triggers only fire when the toggle is ON and the webhook URL is configured.

quotes: 5 automation toggles (WhatsApp Auto-Reply, Proposal Auto-Send, Lead Follow-Up Sequences, Payment Confirmation, Project Onboarding) that read/write from a centralized localStorage-backed config store. All automation triggers fire POST requests to configured webhook URLs with proper JSON payloads and Authorization headers only when their toggle is ON

acceptanceCriteria: 5 toggle switches are shown, each labeled with the automation name
Toggle state persists to localStorage under 'quickbee_automation_config'
Automation trigger utility function checks toggle state before firing
POST request includes JSON payload with event type and relevant data
POST includes Authorization header using saved API Key
If toggle is OFF or webhook URL is not configured, the POST is skipped
Each fired request is logged to the Webhook Logs store

requirements.text: Build the Automation Workflows page displaying 5 workflow cards: New Lead Submission, Meeting Scheduling, Payment Processing, Analytics Engine, and AI Content Creation. Each card shows: workflow name, current status indicator (Idle / Running / Success / Error), a manual Run button that fires the workflow's POST to the Automation Webhook URL, and a result panel displaying the last execution result as formatted/syntax-highlighted JSON.

quotes: 5 workflow cards (New Lead Submission, Meeting Scheduling, Payment Processing, Analytics Engine, AI Content Creation) each with a status indicator, manual Run button, and last execution result displayed as structured JSON

acceptanceCriteria: 5 workflow cards are displayed
Each card shows current status with color-coded badge
Run button triggers a POST to the Automation Webhook URL with workflow-specific payload
Last execution result JSON is displayed in a formatted code block
Status transitions to Running while the request is in-flight
Status updates to Success or Error based on HTTP response
Each run is logged to the Webhook Logs store

requirements.text: Build the Analytics Engine page. Display a date range picker (start date, end date). On submit, POST to the configured Automation Webhook URL with the date range payload. Display a simulated GA4-style analytics report below with: Growth Summary (total sessions, new users, revenue, conversion rate), a sessions-over-time line chart, top traffic sources bar chart, and top performing pages table. Simulate the report data on the frontend if the webhook returns no structured analytics data.

quotes: date range form that POSTs to the automation webhook and displays a simulated GA4 analytics report with growth summary

acceptanceCriteria: Date range picker with start and end date inputs is shown
Submit button POSTs date range to Automation Webhook URL
Growth summary section shows 4 KPI cards (sessions, users, revenue, conversion)
Line chart displays sessions trend over the selected date range
Bar chart shows traffic sources breakdown
Top pages table shows page path, views, and avg session duration
If webhook is not configured, simulated data is shown with a notice

requirements.text: Build the AI Content Creator page. Display a keyword input field and a Generate Content button. On submission, call the configured OpenAI-compatible API with a prompt to generate: an SEO blog post (title + full content), 5 social media captions, a LinkedIn post, and an Instagram carousel outline (5 slides). Display each section in a separate labeled panel with a Copy button per section. Include a full Export button that downloads all generated content as a single .txt or .pdf file.

quotes: keyword input that calls the AI API to generate SEO blog content, social media captions, LinkedIn post, and Instagram carousel outline, with per-section copy buttons and full export

acceptanceCriteria: Keyword input and Generate button are displayed
API call uses saved API Endpoint and API Key from Sales Configuration
4 content sections are rendered: SEO Blog, Social Captions, LinkedIn Post, Instagram Carousel
Each section has an individual Copy button that copies content to clipboard
Export button downloads all content as a single file
Loading state shown while API call is in progress
API call is logged to the Webhook Logs store

requirements.text: Build the Webhook Logs page. Display a chronological table of all outgoing webhook and AI API calls, each entry showing: timestamp, tool/workflow name, target URL, payload summary (first 100 chars), HTTP status code, and success/failure indicator (green for 2xx, red for others). Include filter controls for tool name and status (All / Success / Error). Include a Clear Logs button that wipes all stored logs. Logs must be stored in localStorage under a key like 'quickbee_webhook_logs' and written by a shared utility function used across all modules.

quotes: logs every outgoing webhook and API call with timestamp, URL, tool name, payload summary, HTTP status, colour-coded green/red, filterable by tool and status, with a Clear Logs button

acceptanceCriteria: Log table shows all entries with all 6 fields
Success rows are highlighted green, error rows red
Filter by tool name dropdown filters the table
Filter by status (All/Success/Error) filters the table
Clear Logs button empties the localStorage log store and clears the table
All modules (AI tools, automations, workflows, analytics, content creator) write to this shared log store

requirements.text: Implement a shopping cart system. Each service card's Buy Now button adds the item (with selected tier, add-ons, and quantity) to a cart stored in React context or localStorage. Build a Checkout page that displays all cart items with prices in INR, a total, and a Pay with Razorpay button. Integrate Razorpay checkout using the saved Razorpay Key ID. On successful payment, navigate to PaymentSuccessPage displaying invoice reference in format QBA-{timestamp} and fire the Payment Processing automation workflow POST. On failure, navigate to PaymentFailurePage with an error message and retry option.

quotes: cart with Razorpay integration, Buy Now buttons on every service card, PaymentSuccessPage and PaymentFailurePage that fire the payment processing workflow and display invoice reference in format QBA-{timestamp}

acceptanceCriteria: Buy Now buttons on service cards add items to cart
Checkout page shows all cart items with INR pricing and a grand total
Razorpay checkout opens using the saved Razorpay Key ID
PaymentSuccessPage displays invoice reference in format QBA-{timestamp}
PaymentSuccessPage fires the Payment Processing workflow POST
PaymentFailurePage shows an error message and a Retry button
Cart persists across page navigation (localStorage or React context)

requirements.text: Set up TanStack Router with routes for all pages: / (Dashboard home), /leads (Lead Management), /services (Services Catalog), /service-management (Service Management), /ai-tools (AI Smart Systems), /settings (Sales Configuration), /automation (Automation Dashboard), /workflows (Automation Workflows), /analytics (Analytics Engine), /content-creator (AI Content Creator), /webhook-logs (Webhook Logs), /checkout (Checkout), /payment-success (PaymentSuccessPage), /payment-failure (PaymentFailurePage). Wrap the app with React Query provider.

quotes: Stack: Motoko backend with CRUD for managed services, React and TypeScript frontend, TanStack Router, React Query, Tailwind CSS

acceptanceCriteria: All 14 routes are defined and render the correct page component
Navigating directly to any route renders the correct page
React Query QueryClientProvider wraps the app
TanStack Router is the routing solution (not React Router)

requirements.text: Build a Dashboard home page that shows a summary overview: total leads count (with status breakdown), total services count, recent webhook activity (last 5 log entries), automation status summary (which automations are ON), and quick-action cards linking to each major section. Apply the teal-green glassmorphism card design to all dashboard widgets.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows lead count KPI card with status breakdown
Dashboard shows total services count
Last 5 webhook log entries are displayed
Automation ON/OFF summary is shown
Quick-action cards link to all major sections
All cards use glassmorphism styling

constraints: All Motoko logic must live in a single main actor (backend/main.mo)
Do not use any external authentication — route directly to dashboard
All credential and configuration values must be stored in localStorage on the frontend — do not persist secrets to the Motoko backend
Webhook/API calls must only fire when the corresponding toggle is ON and the target URL is configured
Invoice reference format must be QBA-{timestamp}
All pricing must be in INR (Indian Rupees)
Do not modify any files in frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: User authentication or role-based access control
Actual AI model hosting — all AI calls go to an external OpenAI-compatible endpoint configured by the user
Real GA4 API integration — analytics report is simulated on the frontend
Storing API keys or secrets in the Motoko backend canister
